Package gw.api.test

Class ServerTestClass

java.lang.Object
junit.framework.Assert
junit.framework.TestCase
gw.api.test.TestClass
gw.api.test.ServerTestClass
All Implemented Interfaces:
ITestWithMetadata, junit.framework.Test
Direct Known Subclasses:
CCServerTestClassBase
public class ServerTestClass extends TestClass
Superclass for tests that run in the context of an application server, but that do not test UI functionality.

  • Method Details

    • beforeClass

      protected void beforeClass() throws Exception
      Gets called once before the first test...() method is executed. @Override this in your Test class. When multiple tests are run (e.g. in a suite) for every test method a new TestCase instance is created. The beforeClass() method is called only on the first instance of the test. Be aware of this when in beforeClass() you want to use instance variables - their values will be gone after the first test method call. Set them in beforeMethod() instead.

      If you override this method, remember to call super().

      Overrides:
      beforeClass in class TestClass
      Throws:
      Exception

    • afterClass

      protected void afterClass() throws Exception
      Gets called once when all test...() methods have been run. @Override this in your Test class.

      If you override this method, remember to call super().

      Overrides:
      afterClass in class TestClass
      Throws:
      Exception

    • beforeMethod

      protected void beforeMethod() throws Exception

      If you override this method, remember to call super().

    • setUpCurrentUserIfNecessary

      protected void setUpCurrentUserIfNecessary()
      If there is no current user in the environment, sets one up by calling setCurrentUserToSuperUser()

    • setCurrentUserToSuperUser

      protected void setCurrentUserToSuperUser()
      Looks up the credential for "su" and uses it to set the runtime environment's current user.

    • setUpMutableSystemClock

      protected final void setUpMutableSystemClock()
      Enable the test class to make changes to the system clock. Call this from your beforeClass() method to enable changing the system time; it installs a mock clock that allows the time to be set or advanced. In general, time should be advanced but never set back. Running time backwards can cause strange behaviors, so it is very strongly discouraged.

      To actually change the time in your test, call

      ChangesCurrentTimeUtil.setCurrentTime(TestCase, long) or ChangesCurrentTimeUtil.incCurrentTime(TestCase, long).

      The original clock will be automatically restored in the afterClass() method.

    • restoreDBFromBackup

      protected void restoreDBFromBackup()
      Restore the database state to its last saved state. This is usually the state that was automatically saved after the test server was started.

    • registerPlugin

      protected final <T extends InternalPlugin> void registerPlugin(Class<T> pluginInterface, T implementation)
      Register a replacement plugin implementation for the specified plugin interface.

      The original plugin will be automatically restored in the afterClass() method.

      Parameters:
      pluginInterface - The defined interface for the plugin
      implementation - An instance of a class that implements the plugin interface

    • restorePlugins

      protected final void restorePlugins() throws Exception
      Restore plugins to their default state. Called by afterClass().
      Throws:
      Exception
